name: Gemini
description: Google's sleeper hit. Quietly became the best while everyone was watching OpenAI

name: ChatGPT
description: 800M users who don't know alternatives exist. The Toyota Camry of AI

name: Claude
description: What developers use when they need actual work done. The thinking person's AI

name: Perplexity
description: Google Search if Google still cared about search. Actually cites sources

name: NotebookLM
description: Turns your boring PDFs into podcasts. Google's best kept secret

name: Nano Banana
description: The new king. 4K output that actually follows your prompts. Midjourney is shaking

name: Midjourney
description: Was industry-leading. Still living off 2023 reputation. Discord-only in 2025, seriously?

name: fal.ai
description: 600+ models for devs who actually ship. $200M revenue says something

name: Ideogram
description: The only one that can spell words in images. Low bar, but someone had to clear it

name: Leonardo AI
description: For game devs who can't afford concept artists. Gets the job done

name: Runway
description: The OG that everyone else copied. Gen-3 still slaps

name: HeyGen
description: Lip-sync so good it's probably illegal somewhere. LinkedIn influencers swear by it

name: Sora
description: The hype was insane. The waitlist was longer. Now it's just... fine?

name: Kling
description: TikTok's parent company. 2-min videos that are weirdly good. ByteDance stays winning

name: Veo
description: Google's answer to Sora. Hollywood quality if you can get access

name: Higgsfield
description: Why pick one when you can have all? Sora, Veo, Kling in one place

name: Cursor
description: VSCode but it actually writes your code. Devs are obsessed, rightfully so

name: GitHub Copilot
description: The first, not the best anymore. Your company probably pays for it anyway

name: Replit
description: Online IDE that deletes databases and lies about it. Use at your own risk

name: Bolt.new
description: Vibe-code an entire app in your browser. Deploy before you regret it

name: Canva AI
description: 170M people who gave up on learning Figma. No shame, it works

name: Figma AI
description: For designers who still have standards. AI features are catching up

name: Adobe Firefly
description: Adobe's attempt to stay relevant. Integrated everywhere you're already paying

name: Gamma
description: Death to PowerPoint. AI presentations that don't look like 2005

name: Napkin AI
description: Text to diagrams that actually make sense. 5M users can't be wrong

name: Notion AI
description: For people whose whole life is in Notion. Convenient if you're already there

name: Jasper
description: When ChatGPT and Claude don't work and you want to feel enterprise-y

name: ElevenLabs
description: Voice cloning so real it should probably be regulated. Use responsibly

name: Suno
description: Make a hit song with zero talent. Musicians are not happy about this one

name: v0
description: Vercel's viral moment. Generates React components that actually work

name: Lovable
description: Build apps by describing them. Deploy before your PM changes requirements

name: Emergent
description: Multi-agent chaos that somehow produces working apps. 700K believers

name: Zapier
description: 7000+ integrations. The duct tape holding half of SaaS together

name: Make
description: Zapier but with a visual builder. For people who think in flowcharts

name: n8n
description: Open-source, self-hostable. For when you don't trust SaaS with your data
